abstract: A new movie about the overheated world of Iowa politics and butter sculpting will have to trade more on Hugh Jackman's smile and Olivia Wilde's good looks than on Jennifer Garner's parody of seemingly Michelle Bachmann-like character now that the real-life politician has bowed out of the presidential race.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES- So Michele Bachmann is out of the presidential race. And that means a movie with partisan potential, "Butter," set for release by the Weinstein Company on March 16, will have to trade more on Hugh Jackman's smile and Olivia Wilde's good looks than on Jennifer Garner's parody of a seemingly Bachmann-like character who is caught up in the overheated world of Iowa politics and butter sculpting.
